headline: 2 Top Artificial Intelligence (AI) Stocks to Buy Right Now
summary: The bull market on Wall Street persists, aided by stocks like Nvidia and Microsoft, which are posting tremendous results on the back of the artificial intelligence (AI) boom.  Many people feel the bull market will continue with a perceived business-friendly incoming administration and Big Tech investments in AI.  The number of hyperscale data centers (those over 100,000 square feet) eclipsed 1,000 this year, and the forecast is for at least 120 to come online annually for the foreseeable future.

headline: META vs. MSFT: Which AI Leader Offers Better Long-Term Returns?
summary: Both Meta (META) and Microsoft (MSFT) are at the forefront of the AI revolution. However, which investment is likely to deliver stronger long-term returns? Based on my analysis, Microsoft is better positioned for long-term stock performance, given its stable monetization strategy and significantly more attractive valuation. While I remain bullish on both investments, my preference is heavily skewed toward buying Microsoft over Meta at this time. Meta Has Been Stealthily Winning the AI Arms Race

headline: European Commission close State aid investigations into Fiat, Amazon, Starbucks
summary: In a Wednesday press release, the agency said, “The European Commission has closed three in-depth State aid investigations into transfer pricing tax rulings granted by Luxembourg to Fiat and Amazon (AMZN), and by the Netherlands to Starbucks (SBUX). Following judgments by the EU Courts, the Commission found that the tax rulings did not grant the companies selective advantages. In 2015 and 2017, the Commission found that Luxembourg granted selective tax advantages to Fiat and Amazon, and the Neth

headline: If I Could Only Buy and Hold a Single Stock, This Would Be It
summary: Obviously, that's not an ideal strategy, but in this hypothetical scenario, I know what stock I would choose: Amazon (NASDAQ: AMZN).  Thankfully, Amazon has them.  It combines e-commerce, cloud services, advertising, and artificial intelligence to generate its massive $600 billion-a-year revenue stream.

headline: Jeffs’ Brands announces trademark registration approval for Wellution
summary: Jeffs’ Brands (JFBR), a data-driven e-commerce company operating on the Amazon (AMZN) Marketplace, announced that Wellution, a Wellness and Personal Care brand owned by SciSparc Nutraceuticals (SPRC), its 49% held subsidiary, has received an official registration of its trademark for non-medicated skin care preparations and hair care products. The trademark provides intellectual property protection for Wellution’s innovative offerings in Class 3 goods. Wellution sells on Amazon Marketplace dozen

headline: Googling Is for Old People. That’s a Problem for Google.
summary: If Google were a ship, it would be the Titanic in the hours before it struck an iceberg—riding high, supposedly unsinkable, and about to encounter a force of nature that could make its name synonymous with catastrophe.  The trends moving against Google are so numerous and interrelated that the Justice Department’s attempt to dismantle the company—the specifics of which were unveiled Nov. 20—could be the least of its problems.  Taken together, these forces could lead to long-term decline in Google search traffic, and the outsize profits generated from it, which prop up its parent company  Alphabet  money-losing bets on things like its Waymo self-driving unit.
